belarus.valueDescription: Elections of deputies and other persons elected to state offices by the people shall be general: citizens of the Republic of Belarus who have reached the age of 18 shall be eligible to vote.

gambia.valueDescription: Every citizen of The Gambia being eighteen years or older and of sound mind shall have the right to vote for the purpose of elections of a President and members of the National Assembly, and shall be entitled to be registered as a voter in a National Assembly constituency for that purpose.

turksandcaicosislands.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \u201CThe Constitution of the Turks and Caicos Islands\u201D, Section 55(b): http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/TC/turks-and-caicos-constitution-2014/ ;Electoral Law: \u201CElections Ordinance\u201D, Section 9: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/TC/turks-and-caicos-elections-ordinance-2018/

estonia.valueDescription: \u00A7 57. Any citizen of Estonia who has attained eighteen years of age is eligible to vote.

philippines.valueDescription: Suffrage may be exercised by all citizens of the Philippines not otherwise disqualified by law, who are at least eighteen years of age, and who shall have resided in the Philippines for at least one year and in the place wherein they propose to vote for at least six months immediately preceding the election. No literacy, property, or other substantive requirement shall be imposed on the exercise of suffrage.

cuba.valueDescription: Source:Electoral Law: \"Ley electoral (1992)\", art. 5. See more at: http://mipais.cuba.cu/cat.php?idcat=77&idpadre=76&nivel=2

mauritius.valueDescription: \"a person shall be entitled to be registered as an elector if, and shall not be so entitled unless -he is a Commonwealth citizen of not less than the age of 18 years;\"

sanmarino.valueDescription: Source:Electoral law N.6 of 31 January 1996, Art. 1: http://www.consigliograndeegenerale.sm/contents/instance18/files/document/21801leggi_5336.pdf (2012);Constitution, Art. 7, (Available on the Official Website of the Parliament: http://www.consigliograndeegenerale.sm);

dominicanrepublic.valueDescription: Source:Constituci\u00F3n: Constituci\u00F3n de la Rep\u00FAblica Dominicana (2015) art. 21 y 22 (1): http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/DO/republica-dominicana-constitucion-politica-2015/ (2020)

armenia.valueDescription: Citizens of the Republic of Armenia that have attained the age of 18 on the day of the voting shall have the right to vote in the Republic of Armenia.

vietnam.valueDescription: The citizen, regardless of nationality, sex, social background, religious belief, cultural standard, occupation, time of residence, shall, upon reaching the age of eighteen, have the right to vote.

australia.valueDescription: If a person is only 17 years old and an Australian citizen then they may provisionally enroll, but will not be able to vote unless he/she has turned 18 by polling day.Commonwealth Electoral Act (1918), Section 93: Persons entitled to enrolment and to vote: (1) Subject to subsections (7) and (8) and to Part VIII, all persons:(a) who have attained 18 years of age.

equatorialguinea.valueDescription: Source:Law No. 7/2012 of 16 November 2012 regulating elections to the Chamber of Deputies and the Senate, municipal elections and referenda

unitedkingdom.valueDescription: Source:Representation of the People Act 1983, Art. 1(c)

turkey.valueDescription: All Turkish citizens over eighteen years of age shall have the right to vote in elections and to take part in referenda.

ukraine.valueDescription: Citizens of Ukraine who have attained the age of eighteen on the day elections and referenda are held, have the right to vote.

austria.valueDescription: The age for election was decreased by each of the provinces from 18 to 16 individually, prompting a decrease in voting age federally.

cocos.valueDescription: 93(1) Subject to subsections (7) and (8) and to Part VIII, all persons:(a) who have attained 18 years of age;shall be entitled to enrolment.(3) An elector:(a) whose name has been placed on a Roll in pursuance of a claim made under section 100; and(b) who has not attained 18 years of age on the date fixed for the polling in an election;is not entitled to vote at that election.

southafrica.valueDescription: A person of 16 years or older may apply for registration but, if the application is successful, the applicant\u2019s name may only be placed on the voters\u2019 roll once the applicant reaches the age of 18 years.

cambodia.valueDescription: Khmer citizens of both sexes, at least eighteen years old, have the right to vote.

monaco.valueDescription: Source:Constitution, Art. 53;Law 839 regulating communal and national elections, as amended in 2002, Art. 1

hungary.valueDescription: Source:Act XXXVI of 2013 on Electoral Procedure (last modified by Act CCVII of 2013), Section 102(2): http://njt.hu/cgi_bin/njt_doc.cgi?docid=159995.329468.

kenya.valueDescription: every adult citizen has a right to vote. An adult being anyone who has attained the age of 18 and above.

greenland.valueDescription: The voting age is governed by the Constitution of Denmark for Federal Elections. The electoral age to local councils and parochial church councils may vary as it may be established by an Act or in pursuance of an Act passed by the Inatsisartut in Greenland.

greece.valueDescription: Art. 4.1. Greek men and women citizens who have completed their eighteenth year of agehave a right to vote.

paraguay.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: Constituci\u00F3n Nacional de la Rep\u00FAblica del Paraguay, art. 120:http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/PY/constitucion/Paraguay%20%281992%29.pdf/ (1992)

palau.valueDescription: Source:Voting Rights Act of 1981, as amended, Sec. 1401 (23 PNCA \u00A71401).

vanuatu.valueDescription: A person shall be eligible for registration in the electoral list for the polling district in which he is a resident at the time of the preparation of the electoral list if he \u2013(a) is a citizen; and(b) will have attained 18 years on or before the qualifying date

cyprus.valueDescription: It shall be the right and duty of every citizen who has completed the age of eighteen years to vote at elections and referendums

colombia.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \u201CConstituci\u00F3n Pol\u00EDtica de Colombia\u201D, art. 98, 99:http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/CO/colombia-constitucion-politica-de-colombia-2016 (2016)Electoral Law: \u201CC\u00F3digo Electoral\u201D, art. 3, 4:http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/CO/colombia-codigo-electoral-2016/ (2016)

azerbaijan.valueDescription: Source:Election Code of the Republic of Azerbaijan as amended in 2016, art. 12.1: https://www.legislationline.org/download/id/7885/file/Azerbaijan_Election_am2017_en.pdf (2018).

saudiarabia.valueDescription: There are no provisions for direct national elections, since it is the King who appoints the members of the Shura Council. Only municipal elections are held in Saudi Arabia.

papuanewguinea.valueDescription: Source:Constitution of the Independent State of Papua New Guinea, Section 126 (3): http://www.igr.gov.pg/constitution.pdf (2012)

rwanda.valueDescription: Persons allowed to register on the voters\u2019 register of a a village or of the embassy are all Rwandans of at least eighteen (18) years of age or those who will have attained it on the election day and who reside or temporarily stay in that village or in countries located in the territorial jurisdiction of that embassy.

bosniaandherzegovina.valueDescription: Each citizen of BiH who has attained eighteen (18) years of age shall have the right to vote and to be elected (hereinafter, right to vote) pursuant to this law

afghanistan.valueDescription: An eligible voter shall have completed 18 years of age on the Election Day.

norway.valueDescription: Norwegian nationals must reach the age of 18 no later than December 31 of the election year.

dominica.valueDescription: Source:Constitution of Dominica (1978), Section 33 (2): https://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/DM/dominica-constitution-of-the-commonwealth-of/view (2014).Registration of Electors Act No. 13 of 1974, Section 5 (1): https://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/DM/dominica-registration-of-electors-act-1974/view (2014).Electoral Office of Dominica, Official Website - Who Can Register to Vote?: http://electoraloffice.gov.dm/registration-2/regulations-pertaining-to-the-registration-of-electors-5(2014).

bulgaria.valueDescription: Every citizen above the age of 18, with the exception of those placed under judicial interdiction or serving a prison sentence, shall be free to elect state and local authorities and vote in referendums.

bahrain.valueDescription: Citizens should be 20 years old on the day of referendum or election.

guatemala.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \u201CConstituci\u00F3n pol\u00EDtica de la Rep\u00FAblica de Guatemala (1993)\", art. 147, http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/GT/constitucion/guatemala-constitucio-politica-de-la-republica-de-guatemala-2012/, https://www.constituteproject.org/constitution/Guatemala_1993.pdf; Electoral Law: \u201CLey Electoral y de Partidos Pol\u00EDticos (2016)\", art. 2, http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/GT/guatemala-ley-electoral/

ghana.valueDescription: Every citizen of Ghana of eighteen years of age or above and of sound mind has the right to vote and is entitled to be registered as a voter for the purposes of public elections and referenda.

togo.valueDescription: Source:Electoral Code No. 2000-07 as amended, art. 51: http://www.ifes.org/~/media/Files/Publications/Election%20Law/2005/IFES_19/EL00062.pdf (2013);Constitution, art. 5: http://www.unhcr.org/refworld/country,LEGAL,,LEGISLATION,TGO,456d621e2,48ef43c72,0.html (2013)

thailand.valueDescription: Sec. 95 (2) Being not less than eighteen years of age on 1st January of the year of the election

serbia.valueDescription: The right to elect a representative, as well as to be elected as a representative, shall have a citizen domiciled on the territory of the Republic of Serbia, who is at the same time a citizen of Yugoslavia, who is over 18 years of age and has the business capacity (henceforth: voter).

solomonislands.valueDescription: Art. 55 (1):1. Subject to the provisions of this section, a person shall be entitled to beregistered as an elector if, and shall not be so entitled for registration unless\u2014a. he is a citizen of Solomon Islands; andb. he has attained the age of eighteen years.

libyanarabjamahiriya.valueDescription: Source:Voter Registration Regulation for the Elections of the Council of Representatives, Attached to the Decision of the Board of Commission No. (49) 2014, Article 3(ii): http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/africa/LY/libya-voter-registration-regulation-for-the/view

saotomeandprincipe.valueDescription: Source:Constitution, Art. 57: http://www.gov.st/data/filestorage/docs/constistp.pdf (2016);Electoral Law of the Democratic Republic of Sao Tome and Principe n.\u00BA 11/90 of 26 November 1990, as amended (latest amendment - 2006), art. 6: http://www.stj.st/download/Lei_Eleitoral.pdf (2016)

southsudan.valueDescription: Eligible voters shall satisfy the following conditions: (c) be at least 18 years of age

zambia.valueDescription: 46.A citizen who has attained the age of eighteen years is entitledto be registered as a voter and vote in an election by secret ballot.

comoros.valueDescription: Source:Law No 10-018/AU Amending certain provisions of the Electoral Act No. 07-001/AU of 14 January 2007, art. 9http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/africa/KM/comores-electoral-law-2010/view (2016)

namibia.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: Constitution of Namibia, art. 17 (2)Electoral Law: Electoral Act, art. 16(3)

palestine.valueDescription: Source:Elections Law 2 September 2007 regulating general elections, art. 27 (1-b): http://www.elections.ps/Portals/0/pdf/Election_Law_%282007-Sept_02%29-EN.pdf (2013)

honduras.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \u201CConstituci\u00F3n de la Rep\u00FAblica de Honduras (2009)\u201D, art. 36:http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/HN/honduras-constitucion-politica-de-1982-2012/Electoral Law: \u201CLey electoral y de las organizaciones pol\u00EDticas (2004)\u201D, art. 6.http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/HN/honduras-ley-electoral-y-de-las-organizaciones/

burkinafaso.valueDescription: Source:Electoral Code as amended in 2015, art. 42: http://www.ceni.bf/sites/default/files/Code_\u00E9lectoral_BF-Version_21.05.2015.pdf (2015)

réunion.valueDescription: a) 18 years.The French overseas departments (Guadeloupe, French Guiana, Martinique, R\u00E9union) elects candidates to the French Senate and House of Representatives. The overseas departments follow the same rules as the metropole regarding the organization of the elections. They do however enjoy certain specificities concerning electoral expenditure : certain travel expenses of the candidates are not taken into account in the ceiling of candidates' election expenses (article L.52-12 of the electoral code). Besides, the French Parliament is discussing a bill which would allow elections to be held on Saturday in Guadeloupe, Martinique and Guiana (because of the time lag, people from these departments knew the results of the elections in the metropole before they voted).

maldives.valueDescription: Constitution (2008):26. Unless otherwise provided in this Constitution, every citizen of the Maldives eighteen years of age or older has the right:(a) to vote in elections, and in public referendums, which shall be held by secret ballot

oman.valueDescription: Source:Inter-parliamentary Union: \"OMAN Majles A'Shura (Consultative Council)\" Legal Framework http://www.ipu.org/parline/reports/2378.htm (2015)

timor-leste.valueDescription: Active electoral capacity is granted to all Timorese citizens over 17 years of age.

brazil.valueDescription: The suffrage is voluntary for citizens between 16 and 18 years old and over 70, but it is compulsory for citizens above 18 and under 70 years old.

lesotho.valueDescription: Registration of young voters (to be 18 between the end of the ordinary registration period and the election day).

india.valueDescription: The definition of the qualifying date enacted in pursuance to the provision of Article 14(b), holds fault as it fixes the date as 1st of January 'of the year in which it (the role) is so prepared or revised'. If the rolls are not revised for several years, many citizens although past the age of eighteen years are still not eligible to be on the rolls because the 'qualifying date' required by section 19 has been tied down with these processes.

peru.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \u201CConstituci\u00F3n Pol\u00EDtica del Per\u00FA\u201D, arts. 30 & 31: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/PE/peru-constitucion-politica-2019/ ;Electoral Law: \u201CLey 26859, org\u00E1nica de elecciones\u201D, art. 9: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/PE/peru-ley-26859-organica-elecciones-2019/

saintkittsandnevis.valueDescription: Every Commonwealth citizen of the age of eighteen years or upwards who possesses such qualifications relating to residence or domicile in Saint Christopher and Nevis as Parliament may prescribe shall, unless he or she is disqualified by Parliament from registration as such, be entitled to be registered as a voter for the purpose of electing Representatives in one (but not more than one) constituency in accordance with the provisions of any law in that behalf and no other person may be registered as such.

unitedstates.valueDescription: \"The right of citizens of the United States, who are eighteen years of age or older, to vote shall not be denied or abridged by the United States or by any State on account of age.\"

sierraleone.valueDescription: Every citizen of Sierra Leone being eighteen years of age and above and of sound mind shall have the right to vote, and accordingly shall be entitled to be registered as a voter for the purposes of public elections and referenda.

belize.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \u201CBelize Constitution, Chapter 4\u201D, Section 92: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/BZ/belize-constitution-2017/;Electoral Law: \u201CRepresentation of the People Act, Chapter 9\u201D, Section 5: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/BZ/belize-representation-people-act-2011/

nauru.valueDescription: Members of Parliament shall be elected in such manner as is prescribed by law, by Nauruan citizens who have attained the age of twenty years.

kuwait.valueDescription: Suffrage is extended to all Kuwaitis at the age of 21, except those citizens who have been naturalized for less than 20 years and active members of the armed forces.

slovenia.valueDescription: Every citizen of the Republic of Slovenia who has reached the age of 18 by the Election Day and has not been declared legally incompetent shall have the right to vote and to be elected as a deputy.

zimbabwe.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: Constitution of Zimbabwe, Sch 3, art. 3(1).http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/africa/ZW/zimbabwe-constitution-of-zimbabwe-2008-1/view

macedonia.valueDescription: Every citizen on reaching 18 years of age acquires the right to vote. The right to vote is equal, universal and direct, and is exercised at free elections by secret ballot. Persons deprived of the right to practice their profession by a court verdict do not have the right to vote. (Constitution, Art. 22)

micronesia.valueDescription: Every citizen of the Federated States of Micronesia is eligible to vote in a National Election if he or she has fulfilled the following requirements: (2) is 18 years of age or older on the day of the election.

bolivia.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \"Constituci\u00F3n Pol\u00EDtica del Estado\", art. 26 (II-2): http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/BO/bolivia-constitucion-politica-del-estado-vigente/ (2019); Electoral Law: \u201CLey del R\u00E9gimen Electoral \u2014 Ley 026-2010\u201D, art. 45 (a): http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/BO/bolivia-ley-026-2010-regimen-electoral-vigente/ (2019)

china.valueDescription: All citizens of the People's Republic of China who have reached the age of 18 shall have the right to vote and stand for election, regardless of ethnic status, race, sex, occupation, family background, religious belief, education, property status or length of residence.

capeverde.valueDescription: Source:Constitution of Cape Verde as amended in 2010, art. 55 (2): http://www.parlamento.cv/Downloads/Constitui%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20da%20Rep%C3%BAblica%20de%20Cabo%20verde,%202010.pdf (2016);Electoral Law as amended by Law No 56/VII/2010, art. 5, 369, 403: http://www.parlamento.cv/userfiles/image/site/Leis/Altera%20o%20C%C3%B3digo%20Eleitoral%20-%20texto%20integrante.pdf (2016)

srilanka.valueDescription: The franchise shall be exercisable at the election of the President of the Republic and of the Members of Parliament and at every Referendum by every citizen who has attained the age of eighteen years

americansamoa.valueDescription: Source:Constitution of American Samoa, Art.2:7American Samoa Code Annotated, Title 6, Ch2 (6.0211)

albania.valueDescription: Source:The Constitution of the Republic of Albania, art. 45.

poland.valueDescription: Article 62: 1. If, no later than on the day of vote, he has attained 18 years of age, Polish citizen shall have the right to participate in a referendum and the right to vote for the President of the Republic of Poland as well as representatives to the Sejm and Senate and organs of local government.

costarica.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \u201CConstituci\u00F3n Pol\u00EDtica de la Rep\u00FAblica de Costa Rica\u201D, art. 90: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/CR/costa-rica-constitucion-politica-reformas-2015.pdf/; Electoral Law: \u201CLey 8765: C\u00F3digo Electoral\u201D, art. 144: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/CR/costa-rica-ley-8765-codigo-electoral-2018.pdf/

venezuela.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \u201CConstituci\u00F3n de la Rep\u00FAblica Bolivariana de Venezuela\u201D, art. 64: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/VE/venezuela-constitucion-reforma-2009/ ;Electoral Law: \u201CLey Org\u00E1nica de Procesos Electorales\u201D, art. 29: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/VE/venezuela-ley-organica-procesos-electorales-2009/

malawi.valueDescription: Every Malawian who shall have reached the age of 18 years on the day of the election is eligible to vote.

moldova.valueDescription: Citizens of the Republic of Moldova, who by the day of the elections have reached the age of 18, have the right to vote, except for those legally deprived of this right.

russia.valueDescription: 1. A citizen of the Russian Federation who has attained the age of 18 as of voting day shall be entitled to elect deputies of the State Duma in the federal electoral district.

saintvincentandthegrenadines.valueDescription: Source:Constitution of St. Vincent and the Grenadines 1979, Art 27(2)

sweden.valueDescription: Source:The Instrument of Government, Ch. 3, Art. 4: Official Website of the Parliament: http://www.riksdagen.se/sv/Start/Bestall/Sprakversioner/English---engelska1/Sveriges-grundlagar-och-riksdagsordningen1/ (2012)

madagascar.valueDescription: All Malagasy citizens who are 18 years or older at the date of the poll and in full possession of their civil and political rights are qualified to be registered and vote.

turkmenistan.valueDescription: Source:Constitution of Turkmenistan (2008), art. 89: http://www.legislationline.org/documents/section/constitutions/country/51 (2013);Law of Turkmenistan on Elections of Deputies of the Mejlis of Turkmenistan (2008), art. 2;Law on Elections of the President of Turkmenistan (2011), art. 3 (1)

pitcairnislands.valueDescription: \"11. The following persons being of or over the age of eighteen years shall be qualified to vote...\"

iraq.valueDescription: Voters must be 18 old in the year in which the elections are held.

seychelles.valueDescription: A person who is a citizen of Seychelles and hasattained the age of eighteen years is entitled to be registered as a voter unless the person is disqualified from registration under an Act on the ground of-(a)infirmity of mind;(b)criminality; or(c)residence outside Seychelles.Constitution, art. 114

indonesia.valueDescription: Any Indonesian citizen who, on the voting day, has reached the age of 17 years or more or is/have married shall has the right to vote.

nicaragua.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \u201CConstituci\u00F3n Pol\u00EDtica de Nicaragua (2014)\u201D, art. 47 (1), 51:http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/NI/constitucion/constitucion-politica-de-nicaragua-con-reformas-a/ (2016);Electoral Law No. 331: \u201CLey Electoral No. 331 (enmendada por la ley No. 790 del 23/05/2012)\u201D, art. 30:http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/NI/leyes-electorales/nicaragua-ley-no.-331-ley-electoral-2012/ (2016).

gibraltar.valueDescription: \"3. (1) The persons entitled to vote as electors at elections of members ofthe Parliament (in this Act referred to as \u2018the Parliament\u2019) under the Gibraltar Constitution Order 2006 shall be those persons who\u2013(i) have lived in Gibraltar during the whole of the qualifying period; and(ii) intend to live in Gibraltar either permanently or indefinitely; and(iii) are, on the qualifying date and on the date of the poll, British citizens, British Overseas Territories citizens, British Overseas citizens, British Nationals (Overseas), British protected persons or British subjects under the British Nationality Act 1981, and are 18 years of age or over and are not subject to any legal incapacity to vote;\"

ethiopia.valueDescription: Any Ethiopian who is 18 or more years old on the date of registration shall be eligible for registration as an elector.

ecuador.valueDescription: The vote is mandatory for 18-year old Ecuadorians and optional for people between 16 and 18 years old, and elders more than 65 years old.

guinea-bissau.valueDescription: Source:Electoral Law of 11 November 2009 on the election of the President of the Republic and the National People's Assembly (\"Lei Eleitoral Para Presidente da Rep\u00FAblica e Assembleia Nacional Popular\"), art. 7 (1): http://www.cne-guinebissau.org/phocadownload/lei_eleitoral.pdf (2012)

mauritania.valueDescription: Source:Constitution as amended by Constitutional Law n\u00B0 2012-015, art. 3 (2): www.mauritania.mr (2012)

spain.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \"Constituci\u00F3n Espa\u00F1ola\", arts. 12, 68-70:http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/europe/ES/espana-constitucion-espanola-2011-2016/ ;Electoral Law: \u201CLey Org\u00E1nica 5/1985, de 19 de junio, del R\u00E9gimen Electoral General\u201D art. 2:http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/europe/ES/espana-ley-organica-5-1985-de-19-de-junio-del-1/

algeria.valueDescription: Source:Constitution, art. 50: https://www.constituteproject.org/constitution/Algeria_2008?lang=en (2017);Electoral law (Loi organique n\u00B0 12-01 du 18 Safar 1433 correspondant au 12 janvier 2012 relative au r\u00E9gime \u00E9lectoral), art. 3: https://www.joradp.dz/trv/fcons.pdf(2017)

mozambique.valueDescription: All Mozambican citizens of both sexes who are at least 18 years old on election day have the right to vote.

cameroon.valueDescription: Every person of Cameroonian nationality of either sex, who has reached the age of 20 (twenty) years, is registered on an electoral register and is free from all cases of disqualification provided for by law, shall be entitled to be an elector

portugal.valueDescription: (Assembly of the Republic Electoral Law): All citizens who are over 18 years of age have the right to vote.

lithuania.valueDescription: Citizens who, on the day of the election, have reached 18 years of age shall have the electoral right.

lebanon.valueDescription: Every Lebanese citizen who has completed his twenty-first year is an elector.

mongolia.valueDescription: The right to participate in State management [public administration] affairs directly or through the organs of representation. Have the right to elect and to be elected to the State organs. The right to elect shall be exercised from the age of eighteen years, and the age qualification for being elected shall be determined by law, taking into consideration the requirements for the relevant State organs and official positions concerned.

syrianarabrepublic.valueDescription: Source:The General Electoral Laws of Syria, art 4.

italy.valueDescription: c) For the Chamber of Deputies, voters must be 18 years old by the day of the elections ANDg) For the Senate, voters must be 25 years old.

finland.valueDescription: Every Finnish citizen who has reached eighteen years of age has the right to vote in national elections and referendums. Specific provisions in this Constitution shall govern the eligibility to stand for office in national elections.

unitedarabemirates.valueDescription: The minimum age is 25. However, each Emirate shall be free to determine the method of selection of the citizens representing it in the Federal National Council, as well as the minimum age of voters.

benin.valueDescription: Source:Constitution of 11 December 1990, art. 6: http://www.gouv.bj/sites/default/files/Cour-Constitutionnelle-recueil-des-textes-fondamentaux.pdf (2016);Law n \u00B0 2010-33 of 7 January 2011 setting general rules for the elections in the Republic of Benin, art. 8: http://ddata.over-blog.com/1/35/48/78/Benin-2/Loi-electorale-generale-pour-2011.pdf (2016)

sudan.valueDescription: Source:The Interim National Constitution of 2005, art. 41: http://www.unhcr.org/refworld/docid/4ba749762.html (2012);The National Elections Act 2008, art. 21 (b): http://www.gurtong.org/ResourceCenter/documents/Reports/Elections-09/nationalelectionsact2008.pdf (2012)

sainthelena.valueDescription: Source:Carol George, Office of the Chief Secretary, Saint Helena

chad.valueDescription: Source:Electoral Law N\u00B0 003/PR/2008 amended by law n\u00B0 008/PR/2009, law n\u00B0 007/PR/2010 and law n\u00B0 020/PR/2010, art. 3: https://publicofficialsfinancialdisclosure.worldbank.org/sites/fdl/files/assets/law-library-files/Chad_Electoral%20code_2009_fr.pdf(2016)

cookislands.valueDescription: 18 years of age on the date of the election

liberia.valueDescription: Source:The 1986 Constitution of the Republic of Liberia, Art. 77 (b), http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/africa/LR/liberia-amended-electoral-laws-2014/view

djibouti.valueDescription: ARTICLE 3. - All Djiboutian nationals of both sexes aged 18 years and enjoying their civil and political rights are voters.

tajikistan.valueDescription: A citizen shall have the right to take part in referendum, to elect from the age of 18 years and also be elected from the age fixed by Constitution, Constitutional laws and laws.

fiji.valueDescription: Every citizen who is or will be the age of 18 years and over on or beforethe date of the issue of the writ for the next election of members to Parliament, has the right to be registered as a voter. Every person who is registered as a voter has the right to vote in the election of members of Parliament.Every citizen who is registered as a voter and who is resident in Fiji on the day of the elections is entitled to vote in that election. If the person is not a resident of Fiji or is not present in Fiji on the day of the elections, but is the holder of a valid Fijian passport, is entitled to vote to the extent provided in any written law governing elections.

singapore.valueDescription: Any person who on the prescribed date in any year is a citizen of Singapore; is ordinarily resident in Singapore; and is not less than 21 years of age,shall be entitled to have his/her name entered or retained in a register of electors in that year.

bruneidarussalam.valueDescription: there have not been national elections since 1962, but 18 is the voting age for village elections.

mexico.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \"Constituci\u00F3n Pol\u00EDtica de los Estados Unidos Mexicanos\", art. 34 & 35: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/MX/mexico-constitucion-reformada-a-2014/ (2014)

samoa.valueDescription: A person is qualified to be registered as a voter if the person is 21 years old or above 21 years old

trinidadandtobago.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \u201CConstitution of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago\u201D, Section 51: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/TT/trinidad-and-tobago-constitution-2016/ ;Electoral Law: \u201CRepresentation of the People Act\u201D, Section 12: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/TT/trinidad-and-tobago-rop-2016/

elsalvador.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \u201CConstituci\u00F3n Pol\u00EDtica de la Rep\u00FAblica de El Salvador\u201D, art. 71: https://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/SV/el-salvador-constitucion-2014/

tunisia.valueDescription: Every Tunisian citizen at least 18 years old is eligible to vote if he/she is listed in the Voter Register, enjoys full civil and political rights, and is not subject to any of the forms of disenfranchisement.

bahamas.valueDescription: Subject to the provisions of this Part, a person shall be entitled to be registered as a voter for a constituency if s/he is 18 years of age.

bhutan.valueDescription: 100. Every person who is a citizen of Bhutan as evidenced by a citizenship identity card shall be entitled to be registered as a voter for a constituency, if such a person is: (a) Not younger than eighteen years of age on the qualifying date as specified by the Election Commission;

uganda.valueDescription: (1) Every citizen of Uganda of eighteen years of age or above has aright to vote.(2) It is the duty of every citizen of Uganda of eighteen years of ageor above to register as a voter for public elections and referenda.

gabon.valueDescription: Article 4: Under the conditions provided by law, all Gabonese of both sexes, 18 years of age, possessing their civil and political rights are electors.

côted'ivoire.valueDescription: Source:1)Constitution de la R\u00E9publique de C\u00F4te d'Ivoire (2000), art. 33: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/africa/CI/cote-divoire-constitution-du-23-juillet-2000/view2) Code Electoral (2015), art. 3:http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/africa/CI/cote-divoire-code-electoral-2015/view

kyrgyzstan.valueDescription: The right to vote shall be granted to the citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic having reached 18 years of age.

martinique.valueDescription: 18 years.The French overseas departments (Guadeloupe, French Guiana, Martinique, R\u00E9union) elects candidates to the French Senate and House of Representatives. The overseas departments follow the same rules as the metropole regarding the organization of the elections. They do however enjoy certain specificities concerning electoral expenditure : certain travel expenses of the candidates are not taken into account in the ceiling of candidates' election expenses (article L.52-12 of the electoral code). Besides, the French Parliament is discussing a bill which would allow elections to be held on Saturday in Guadeloupe, Martinique and Guiana (because of the time lag, people from these departments knew the results of the elections in the metropole before they voted).

georgia.valueDescription: Any citizen of Georgia who by the elections has attained or is on the day of election attaining the age of 18 years enjoys the active electoral right.

yemen.valueDescription: Source:General Elections and Referendum Law of 2001, art. 3: http://www.scer.org.ye/english/generalelectionslaw.htm (2012);Constitution, art. 64 (1): http://www.unhcr.org/refworld/category,LEGAL,,,YEM,3fc4c1e94,0.html (2012)

laopeople'sdemocraticrepublic.valueDescription: All Lao citizens, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, beliefs, social status, place of residence, and profession, who are at least 18 years of age, have the right to vote.

argentina.valueDescription: Voting age for native Argentines is 16 years old while voting age for naturalized Argentines in 18 years old.

czechrepublic.valueDescription: Art. 18: (3) Every citizen of the Czech Republic who has attained the age of eighteen years shall have the right to vote.

zanzibar.valueDescription: Source:Electoral Act No. 11 of 1984 as amended, art. 11;The Constitution of Zanzibar as amended, art. 7http://www.wipo.int/edocs/lexdocs/laws/en/tz/tz028en.pdf (2016)http://www.temco.udsm.ac.tz/images/stories/Electral_Laws/ZANZIBAR-ELECTION-ACT-2010.pdf (2016)

jordan.valueDescription: Any Jordanian national who became 18 calendar years of age ninety days prior to the date .A established for the elections shall have the right to elect members to the Chamber of Deputies in accordance with the provisions of this Law.

swaziland.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: Constitution of the Kingdom of Swaziland, art. 88 (1).

slovakia.valueDescription: 2(1): A person has the right to vote in elections for the National Council of the Slovak Republic (in this Act referred to as \"the right to vote\") if he or she (an \"elector\") is a citizen of the Slovak Republic and is at least eighteen years old on polling day.

belgium.valueDescription: Article 61The members of the House of Representatives are elected directly by citizens who are at least eighteen years of age and who do not fall within the categories of exclusion stipulated by the law.Each elector has the right to only one vote.Article 1.\u00A7 1. In order to be eligible to vote one needs to fulfill the following conditions:1\u00B0 be a Belgian citizen2\u00B0 is at least 18 years of age;3\u00B0 be enlisted in the population register in a Belgian municipality or a population register in adiplomatic post or consulate4\u00B0 not be in one of the situations or cases of exclusion mentioned in the present Code.\u00A7 2. The conditions mentioned in \u00A7 1st, 2\u00B0 and 4\u00B0, shall be met on the day of theelections. The conditions listed in \u00A7 1, 1\u00B0 and 3\u00B0, shall be fulfilled on the date of the closure of thevoters\u2019 list\u00A7 3. Voters who fail to satisfy the conditions mentioned in \u00A7 1, 1\u00B0 or 3\u00B0 between thedate or closure or the voters\u2019 register and the day or the elections shall be deleted from the voters\u2019register.Voters who are arrested or convicted after the voters\u2019 list has been established, shall be eitherexcluded or suspended from the right to vote and shall be deleted from the voters\u2019 register on the dayof the elections.

uzbekistan.valueDescription: Source:Constitution of the Republic of Uzbekistan (1992 as amended in April 2014), art. 117 (2): http://elections.uz/eng/legislation/constitution_of_the_republic_of_uzbekistan.mgr (2014);Law on Elections of the Oliy Majlis of the Republic of Uzbekistan as amended in August 2014, art. 2 (1);Law of the Republic of Uzbekistan on the Elections of the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan (1991), art. 2: http://elections.uz/rus/zakonodatelstvo/zakon_respubliki_uzbekistan_o_viborax_prezidenta_respubliki_uzbekistan_1.mgr (2014).

virginislandsbritish.valueDescription: 68.\u2014(1) Subject to subsection (3), a person shall be qualified to be registered as a voter for thepurposes of elections if, and shall not be so qualified unless, he or she belongs to the VirginIslands and on the qualifying date has attained the age of eighteen years and he or she either\u2014

tanzania.valueDescription: Every citizen of the United Republic who has attained the age of eighteen years is entitled to vote in any election held in Tanzania.

northkorea.valueDescription: A national of 19 years of age or above shall have a voting right for the elections of the President and the members of the National Assembly

croatia.valueDescription: All Croatian citizens who have reached the age of eighteen years (voters) shall be entitled to universal and equal suffrage in elections for the Croatian Parliament, the President of the Republic of Croatia and the European Parliament and in decision-making procedures by national referendum, in compliance with law.

niue.valueDescription: Source:Niue Assembly Act 1966, as amended, Art. 12.

morocco.valueDescription: Source:Organic Law No. 27-11 on the House of Representatives, art. 3: http://www.adrare.net/XYIZNWSK2/elements/pdf/loi_chambredesrepresentants.pdf (2012);Constitution, art. 30: http://www.parlement.ma/fe/images/CONST/constitution%20du%201er%20juillet%202011.pdf (2012)

tokelau.valueDescription: Article 3: Qualification of votersA person is qualified to be a voter in elections for the General Fono if on 31 December of the year preceding the election that person \u2013(i) is at least 18 years of age, and

suriname.valueDescription: The members of the National Assembly shall be elected directly by the inhabitants having Suriname nationality and having reached the age of eighteen years.

romania.valueDescription: Article 36: (1) Every citizen having turned eighteen up to or on the election day shall have the right to vote.

angola.valueDescription: 143 (1) Members shall be elected by universal, free, equal, direct, secret and periodic suffrage by national citizens aged over eighteen who are resident in national territory, including Angolan citizens resident abroad for the purposes of work, study, illness or similar reasons.

frenchguiana.valueDescription: 18.The French overseas departments (Guadeloupe, French Guiana, Martinique, R\u00E9union) elects candidates to the French Senate and House of Representatives. The overseas departments follow the same rules as the metropole regarding the organization of the elections. They do however enjoy certain specificities concerning electoral expenditure : certain travel expenses of the candidates are not taken into account in the ceiling of candidates' election expenses (article L.52-12 of the electoral code). Besides, the French Parliament is discussing a bill which would allow elections to be held on Saturday in Guadeloupe, Martinique and Guiana (because of the time lag, people from these departments knew the results of the elections in the metropole before they voted).

latvia.valueDescription: Article 1. Citizens of Latvia who have reached the age of 18 by election day have the right to vote.

puertorico.valueDescription: Source:Constitution: \u201CConstituci\u00F3n del Estado Libre Asociado de Puerto Rico\u201D, art. VI (s. 4): http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/PR/puerto-rico-constitucion-1970/ ;Electoral Law: \u201CC\u00F3digo Electoral de Puerto Rico de 2020\u201D, art. 5.3: http://aceproject.org/ero-en/regions/americas/PR/puerto-rico-ley-58-2020-codigo-electoral-2020/

kazakhstan.valueDescription: 1. Universal active suffrage shall be the right of citizens of the Republic to take part in the voting at elections upon reaching the age of eighteen years irrespectively of his/her birth, origin, social, official and property status, sex, race, ethnicity, language, relation to religion, belief, place of residence or any other circumstances.

holysee.valueDescription: The suffrage is limited to cardinals who are less than 80 years old.

egypt.valueDescription: Source:Law No. 73 of the year 1956 Regulating the Exercise of Political Rights and its Amendments, art. 1: http://www.democracy-reporting.org/files/law_on_the_exercise_of_political_rights_including_amendments_to_december.pdf (2012).

myanmar.valueDescription: Every citizen who has attained 18 years of age on the day on which the election commences has the right to vote.

iceland.valueDescription: Every Icelandic citizen who has reached the age of 18 and is domiciled in Iceland is eligible to vote in parliamentary elections to the Althing when elections take place.

montenegro.valueDescription: Article 45: (1) The right to elect and stand for elections shall be granted to the citizen of Montenegro who is 18 years of age or above and who has minimum two years of residence in Montenegro.

tuvalu.valueDescription: Source:Electoral Provisions (Parliament) Act as amended, art. 5 (2).Constitution of Tuvalu, art. 91 (1).

barbados.valueDescription: Source:Representation of the People's Act: Section 7.

hongkong.valueDescription: A natural person is not eligible to be registered as an elector unless- (a) the person has reached 18 years of age; or (b) the person's eighteenth birthday falls-(i) in any year other than a year in which a District Council ordinary election is to be held, on or before 25July next following the person's application for registration; or(ii) in a year in which a District Council ordinary election is to be held, on or before 25 September next following the person's application for registration.
